name: European Association for Local Democracy
goal:
The European Association for Local Democracy (ALDA) is a non-governmental organisation dedicated to the promotion of good governance and citizen participation at the local level. ALDA in particular focuses on activities that facilitate cooperation between local authorities and civil society.
ALDA was established in 1999 at the initiative of the Council of Europe's Congress of Local and Regional Authorities to coordinate and support a network of Local Democracy Agencies which was established in the early 1990s. It remains one of its supporting programmes. It is the umbrella organisation of the Local Democracy Agencies which are self-sustainable, locally registered NGOs that act as promoters of good governance and local self-government.
interests: Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Public Health, Regional Policy, Sport, Youth
euInitiatives:
All policies areas and thematic priorities listed below:

1. Active Citizenship
a. Empower citizens to participate in the public life of their communities;
b. Remove the barriers to participation, especially with regard to people who are less involved in social life (youth, elderly, women, minorities);
c. Mobilise citizens to respond locally to global issues.

2. Culture and Sport
a. Promote art and culture as forms of participation and active citizenship;
b. Stimulate creativity and innovation;
c. Promote sport as a tool for social cohesion, tolerance, integration and inclusion

3. Education
a. Promote non formal education approaches to life long learning
b. Tackle early school leaving;
c. Encourage youngsters and adults’ mobility and exchange of experience;
d. Promote integration and tolerance

4. Employment, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
a. Stimulate the spirit of innovation, the creativity, the mobility and the business-entrepreneurial attitude of unemployed people;
b. Equip unemployed people with information, resources, advice and networks to promote entrepreneurship and access to the job market;
c. Promote fair and inclusive economic activities that reduce inequalities such as social and solidarity economy.

5. Good local governance
a. Promote the exchange of good practices related to local governance;
b. Promote the multi-stakeholder approach as evidence-base successful process for community development;
c. Create and strengthen town networks in order to develop cooperation between municipalities
d. Develop local authorities’ and citizens’ capacities

6. Health and Environment
a. Promote the adoption and use of ecological and sustainable products and solutions;
b. Promote circular economy models;
c. Support activities to protect the nature capital and local biodiversity;
d. Raise local authorities and citizens’ awareness on the environmental impact of their actions.

7. Migration
a. Promote tolerance, integration and dialogue between migrants and host communities;
b. Provide migrants with opportunities, tools and useful competences to help them integrate in a new social and economic context
c. Promote migrants’ participation in public life

8. Equal opportunities, minorities and vulnerable groups
a. Promote social cohesion, equality and equal opportunities;
b. Tackle economic and social barriers to civic participation;
c. Foster active participation in community life of the most disadvantaged groups and individuals (women, young, elderly, foreigners, minorities, etc.).

9. Social issues
a. Tackle inequality, poverty and social exclusion;
b. Build the capacities of excluded sectors of the community to make their voice heard and fully participate in the democratic life;
c. Tackle illegality and corruption in Europe.

10. Youth
a. Provide adequate knowledge, competences and skills to young people to tackle youth unemployment;
b. Empower youth to respond locally to global issues
Stimulate youth participation and social engagement through the promotion of activism and volunteering.
